p: Probabilities of influenza infectionâ€“b h1 and b h3, respectively for A/H1N1 and A/H3N2 and b v and b y, respectively for B/Victoria and B/Yamagata, were calibrated two by two simultaneously (A together and B together, but not A and B together) for all seasons (2011 to 2018) ( Fig 2). In addition, to replicate yearly variations in influenza peaks and dominance of one lineage or subtype over the other, first it was calibrated, for example, b vi and b yi for the first year i = 2011. The final state of year i was the initial state of year i + 1. Then it was calibrated b vi + 1 and b yi + 1 for year i + 1, taking into account the population immune status acquired in previous years. Each year, the population was vaccinated with a TIV containing the B lineage used the respective year.
